title: Speed governors must by March 2016, says RTO
content:
Comment  ·  print ·  T  T 

T+·  T- 

All types of transport and goods vehicles, registered prior to 2012 in the district and did not have speed governors, should install Speed Limiting Devices (SLD) by March 2016, Regional Transport Officer (RTO) J. Sheik Mohamed has said. 

As per the amendments to Rule 118 of the Central Motor Vehicles Act, 1989, speed governors should be fitted in transport vehicles with a maximum preset speed limit of 80 km per hour, he told reporters here on Tuesday. 

While transport vehicles registered during the past two years were found fitted with speed governors, other vehicles plying in the district were required to install the device and obtain clearance certificate from the RTO, he said. 

Presently, there were more than 4,000 transport vehicles in the district, including 421 government and private buses, 2,081goods vehicles, 519 Maxi cabs and 1,011 tourist taxies without speed governors, he said. Stating that police vehicles, fire service vehicles and ambulances were exempted, he said that for buses and tourist taxies, the maximum speed limit was 80 km per hour, while it was 60 km for water tankers and 50 km for school buses. 

Installation of speed governors had been made compulsory for all school buses, he said. There were 438 school buses in the district and all of them were issued fitness certificates after a thorough inspection in May, ahead of the reopening of schools. The transport vehicles would be given six months time for installing SLDs from October 1 to March 31, 2016, Mr. Sheik Mohamed said.
